terrainmapper.name: Terrain Mapper
terrainmapper.controls.fill-by-grid.name: Fill by grid
terrainmapper.controls.fill-by-los.name: Fill by line-of-sight
terrainmapper.controls.fill-space.name: Fill space enclosed by walls
terrainmapper.scene-config.backgroundEle: The default elevation for tokens placed on the canvas.
terrainmapper.active-effect-config.dupli: When enabled, this terrain effect may be applied multiple times to a single token
terrainmapper.active-effect-config.displ: When disabled, the terrain status icon will not display on affected tokens.
terrainmapper.region-config.algorithm.hi: Apply a physical shape to the region's elevation. 'None' keeps the Foundry default. 'Plateau' treats the region like a plateau or mesa. Tokens entering the region will move to the plateau elevation and will be considered 'burrowing' if under that elevation. 'Ramp' is similar to 'Plateau' but applies a slope starting at the floor elevation and moving up to the plateau elevation in the given direction. Tokens that leave the region will 'fall' back to the ground unless flying.
terrainmapper.region-config.plateauEleva: When moving into the region, the token will be set to this elevation. For ramps, this is the topmost elevation of the ramp. For a typical scene, try setting the region top to this elevation and the region bottom to negative infinity.
terrainmapper.region-config.rampFloor.hi: For ramps only. Ramp elevation starts here and goes up to the Plateau Elevation. To create a wedge shape, set this value to the scene elevation.
terrainmapper.region-config.rampDirectio: 0ยบ is due south; 90ยบ is due west. For ramps only.
terrainmapper.region-config.rampStepSize: How tall, in grid units, to make each step of the ramp. The number of steps will be automatically determined based on this value. If set to 0, the ramp will approximate a smooth incline. For ramps only.
terrainmapper.tile-config.isFloor.name: Treat as Floor
terrainmapper.tile-config.isFloor.hint: When enabled, will be treated as a solid floor (ground) when moving tokens.
terrainmapper.tile-config.trimAlphaBorde: When enabled, the transparent border of the tile will be ignored for purposes of token movement.
The minimum radius, in grid units, of transparent pixels to treat any given pixel on the tile as a hole. The width of a normal token is a good default. Set to 0 to ignore holes.
terrainmapper.tile-config.alphaThreshold: What percentage transparency counts for treating a given pixel as a hole or outer boundary. Default in Foundry is 0.75.
terrainmapper.behavior.types.add-terrain: Select terrain that will be added to the token as an active effect.
terrainmapper.behavior.types.set-terrain: Select terrain that will be added to the token as an active effect. When the token exits the region, the terrain will be automatically removed.
terrainmapper.behavior.types.add-terrain: When enabled, all other terrains on the token will be removed.
When enabled, dragging the token will not reveal the existence of the terrain to users.
terrainmapper.behavior.types.remove-terr: Select one or more terrains that will be removed from the token. Leave blank to remove all terrains.
Enable to keep the selected terrains and remove all the rest from the token.
terrainmapper.behavior.types.set-elevati: When moving into the region, the token will be set to this elevation. For a typical scene, you should set the region top to this elevation and the region bottom to negative infinity.
When enabled, the token's elevation will be reset to the scene's background elevation when the token exits the region.
Plateau: Token moves to designated max height; Ramp: Token moves gradually from min to max elevation along a specified direction; Stairs: Token moves up/down to set max/min elevations.
The elevation to set when the token leaves the region. For stairs, this serves as the bottom elevation of the stairs.
0 is due south; 90 is due west. Does nothing unless method chosen is 'Ramp'.

How tall, in grid units, to make each step of the ramp. The number of steps will be automatically determined based on this value. If set to 0, the ramp will approximate a smooth incline. Does nothing unless method chosen is 'Ramp'.
If enabled, tokens entering the region will be ignored unless at the designated minimum elevation (or maximum, for stairs).
